nexttext: Then, for CP conservation, the DM number density is given by $n_{\rm DM}=n_\chi+n_{\chi^*}$, for $n_{\chi}=n_{\chi^*}$, and  the effective $3\rightarrow 2$ annihilation cross section is obtained as

We note that all the $Z_5$-invariant quartic couplings between $\chi$ and $S$ participate in the $\chi\chi\chi\rightarrow \chi^*\chi^*$ process.

Assuming that the dark Higgs and dark gauge boson are heavy enough and ignoring the mixing quartic coupling between $\chi$ and dark Higgs field, we also obtain the $2\rightarrow 2$  self-scattering processes for $\chi$ as
prevtext: Then, for CP conservation, the DM number density is given by $n_{\rm DM}=n_\chi+n_{\chi^*}$, for $n_{\chi}=n_{\chi^*}$, and  the effective $3\rightarrow 2$ annihilation cross section is obtained as
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\langle\sigma v^{2}\rangle_{\chi,3\rightarrow 2}=\frac{\sqrt{5}}{1536\pi m^{3}%
_{\chi}}\,|{\cal M_{\chi\chi\chi\rightarrow\chi^{*}\chi^{*}}}|^{2}\equiv\frac{%
\alpha^{3}_{\rm eff}}{m^{5}_{\chi}}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt><mrow><mn>1536</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>χ</mi><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mrow><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><msup><mi>χ</mi><mo>*</mo></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>χ</mi><mo>*</mo></msup></mrow></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo>≡</mo><mfrac><msubsup><mi>α</mi><mi>eff</mi><mn>3</mn></msubsup><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>χ</mi><mn>5</mn></msubsup></mfrac></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
We note that all the $Z_5$-invariant quartic couplings between $\chi$ and $S$ participate in the $\chi\chi\chi\rightarrow \chi^*\chi^*$ process.

Assuming that the dark Higgs and dark gauge boson are heavy enough and ignoring the mixing quartic coupling between $\chi$ and dark Higgs field, we also obtain the $2\rightarrow 2$  self-scattering processes for $\chi$ as
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\sigma_{\chi,\rm self}=\frac{1}{64\pi m^{2}_{\chi}}(|{\cal M}_{\chi\chi}|^{2}+%
|{\cal M}_{\chi\chi^{*}}|^{2})." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>self</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>64</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>χ</mi></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>χ</mi><mo>*</mo></msup></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: Then, for CP conservation, the DM number density is given by $n_{\rm DM}=n_S+n_{S^*}$, for $n_{S}=n_{S^*}$, and the effective $3\rightarrow 2$ annihilation cross section is obtained as

We note that only $\lambda_{1,2}$ quartic couplings between $\chi$ and $S$ participate in the $SSS\rightarrow S^*S^*$ process.

Similarly to the $\chi$ SIMP case, when dark Higgs and dark gauge boson are heavy enough and ignoring the mixing quartic coupling between $S$ and dark Higgs field, the $2\rightarrow 2$  self-scattering processes for $S$ is given by
prevtext: Then, for CP conservation, the DM number density is given by $n_{\rm DM}=n_S+n_{S^*}$, for $n_{S}=n_{S^*}$, and the effective $3\rightarrow 2$ annihilation cross section is obtained as
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\langle\sigma v^{2}\rangle_{S,3\rightarrow 2}=\frac{\sqrt{5}}{1536\pi m^{3}_{S%
}}\,|{\cal M_{SSS\rightarrow S^{*}S^{*}}}|^{2}\equiv\frac{\alpha^{3}_{\rm eff}%
}{m^{2}_{S}}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt><mrow><mn>1536</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mrow><mrow><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><msup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo>*</mo></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒮</mi><mo>*</mo></msup></mrow></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo>≡</mo><mfrac><msubsup><mi>α</mi><mi>eff</mi><mn>3</mn></msubsup><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mfrac></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
We note that only $\lambda_{1,2}$ quartic couplings between $\chi$ and $S$ participate in the $SSS\rightarrow S^*S^*$ process.

Similarly to the $\chi$ SIMP case, when dark Higgs and dark gauge boson are heavy enough and ignoring the mixing quartic coupling between $S$ and dark Higgs field, the $2\rightarrow 2$  self-scattering processes for $S$ is given by
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E7.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\sigma_{S,{\rm self}}=\frac{1}{64\pi m^{2}_{S}}(|{\cal M}_{SS}|^{2}+|{\cal M}_%
{SS^{*}}|^{2})." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>σ</mi><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>self</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>64</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">|</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℳ</mi><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>S</mi><mo>*</mo></msup></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">|</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: As a result, there appears a nonzero cross section for the $2\rightarrow 2$ annihilation of SIMP dark matter, $\chi\chi^*(SS^*)\rightarrow l^+ l^-$, as follows,
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E8.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\langle\sigma v\rangle_{\rm scatt,l^{\pm}}=\frac{24\pi q^{2}_{\chi(S)}\alpha_{%
D}\alpha\,\varepsilon^{2}m^{2}_{\chi(S)}}{m^{4}_{V}}\,\Big{(}\frac{T}{m_{\chi}%
}\Big{)}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>scatt</mi><mo>,</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>±</mo></msup></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mfrac><mrow><mn>24</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>q</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>α</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>ε</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mn>4</mn></msubsup></mfrac></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="160%" minsize="160%">(</mo><mfrac><mi>T</mi><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>χ</mi></msub></mfrac><mo maxsize="160%" minsize="160%">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext: As a result, there appears a nonzero cross section for the $2\rightarrow 2$ annihilation of SIMP dark matter, $\chi\chi^*(SS^*)\rightarrow l^+ l^-$, as follows,
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E9.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\langle\sigma v\rangle_{\rm ann,l^{+}l^{-}}=\frac{32\pi q^{2}_{\chi(S)}\alpha_%
{D}\alpha\,\varepsilon^{2}m^{2}_{\chi(S)}}{(4m^{2}_{\chi(S)}-m^{2}_{V})^{2}}\,%
\Big{(}\frac{T}{m_{\chi}}\Big{)}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟨</mo><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">⟩</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>ann</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mfrac><mrow><mn>32</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>q</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>α</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>ε</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mrow><mi>χ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mo>-</mo><msubsup><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="160%" minsize="160%">(</mo><mfrac><mi>T</mi><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>χ</mi></msub></mfrac><mo maxsize="160%" minsize="160%">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>
